task.title: Add Shifts
task.shortdesc: Shifts represent expected work hours to be assigned in Workforce Management. Shifts can be included in a schedule template. The Team Schedule page enables managers to select a day and update coverage requirements for the week in the pop-up window.

taskbody.context:
Four options are available to add shifts:
add for multiple employees over multiple days
add for an individual employee (edit assigned shifts or add/edit individual shifts)
add via drag and drop
add via the collapsible employee detail card

step.cmd: In the top left corner, select a team.

To add a shift to multiple employees over multiple days, select Add Shift from the Team Schedule page. The schedule must be in Draft or In Revision status to edit. If a schedule is published, you must first select Edit Schedule for the Add Shift button to appear.

substep.cmd: Select the type, date(s), and start and end times.
If labor metrics such as job and location were assigned to the scheduling team and marked as required, then you need to select the labor metric from the drop-down lists.
Select the employees, and then select Add Shift.

step.cmd: To edit assigned shifts for an employee, select the Edit (pencil) icon next to the employee's name. Selecting this icon enables you to mass edit. For example, if an employee has shifts assigned Monday through Friday, then you can select all the shifts to assign. To edit an individual shift, select the shift in the date column and complete the Shift Detail card.
To add a shift for an employee, select a team and click in the desired date column next to the employee's name.

substep.cmd: Enter the start and end times.
Select the labor metrics, if applicable.

step.cmd: To add a shift as Unassigned, select Add Shift from the Team Schedule page. The same fields must be completed; the additional Employee field is optional. If an employee is not selected, the saved shift appears on the Team Schedule page next to "Unassigned." This shift can be applied to an employee via drag and drop functionality or by editing and selecting an employee that will be assigned to the shift.

To filter your list of shifts by labor metrics, select Show Filters to the right of the schedule. If you choose to sort by hire date or employee ID, the information appears under each employee's name in the list.

To add a shift via the collapsible employee detail card, click in a cell next to the employee's name. The pop-up window displays the employee's preferred and available times. If a time span is selected, the Start Time and End Time fields are auto populated. When an employee's shift or new shift is selected, the schedule for that day only appears, rather than the schedule for the week.

substep.cmd: Enter the start and end times.

Select Yes or No to indicate if the employee is in charge for the selected shift. (This option appears only if the Allow In Charge On Shift option was set to Yes when the scheduling team was configured.)
Select the labor metrics, if applicable.
If you need to add a note, select Actions and then Note.
